trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when the platform dependency is not found during activation of the ClickOnce deployment and the deployment will not run.
This exception is thrown when there is a mismatch between the platform requested in the deployment manifest and the platform that ClickOnce is trying to run the application on.
In this context, "platform" can refer to the operating system, the installed versions of the common language runtime, or a previously installed assembly.
For example, if the ClickOnce application asserts that it requires Windows XP and the user is trying to run the application on Windows 2000, this exception will occur.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.DependentPlatformMissingException"></xref> class.

This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "DefaultMessageDisplayedByParameterlessCtorWriterMustSupply".
This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.InsufficientMemoryException>.
Property
Value
`null`.
The localized error message string.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.DependentPlatformMissingException"></xref> class with a specified message that describes the error.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Deployment.Application.DependentPlatformMissingException>.
Property
Value
`null`.
The error message string specified in `message`.
The message that describes the exception.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.DependentPlatformMissingException"></xref> class.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.DependentPlatformMissingException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed to the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Deployment.Application.DependentPlatformMissingException>.
Property
Value
`null`.
The error message string specified in `message`.
The message that describes the exception.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
If the innerException parameter is not `null`, the current exception is raised in a `catch` block that handles the inner exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.DependentPlatformMissingException"></xref> class.
The exception message.
The URL to visit for product support information.
Gets the object data.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.
Gets a URI that indicates where support can be found for the problem encountered.
A URI that indicates where support can be found for the problem encountered.
